summary:
For ENB V0.123 (or previous ENB, V0.119)
Derived from my previous ENB \"Wind of the Nords\"
This is a tweaked and adapted ENB of Midras\' Fallout 3 ENB.
Colourful and vibrant with deep shadows.
Small performance hit
descriptionHtml:
[center][img]http://tof.canardpc.com/view/937ced16-0d38-4955-80bf-71194dffff4e.jpg[/img][/center]

[img]http://tof.canardpc.com/view/f9050d66-321d-4938-9d0b-610bb5d280c2.jpg[/img]

To sum up, this ENB adds :
- Vibrant colors
- Deep shadows in interiors and exteriors, forests will now look intimidating.
- Blue sky with breathtaking colors in sunset and sunrise
- Nordic blueish night with vibrant auroras and stars (no pitch black night...have you seen those Masser and Secunda moons??)
- Performance friendly 
- Blueish distant fog to hide the UGLY distant lod

Breeze of the Nords ENB is derivated from[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/26995] Wind of the Nords[/url], but add it\'s own atmosphere to Skyrim. It\'s made with it\'s author personnal tastes and as we all know, tastes can vary to a very wide range. Like most ENBs, it has flaws and can\'t be perfect under all conditions, I had to make some compromises. Look at the screenshots and, if you like what you see, why don\'t you give this ENB a go ?

I am not going to lie to you saying \"it\'s a realistic ENB\" or whatever, heck no. I play Skyrim to be in a fantasy world full of magics, so this ENB try to give the most a pleasant fantasy feeling to the colors and lightings. I just hope you will enjoy your strolls in Skyrim with this ENB as much as I do.

This ENB is intended to work with the newest[url=http://www.enbdev.com/mod_tesskyrim_v0123.htm] v0.123 ENB[/url] but it also work fine with the previous ENB V0.119. The lastest ENB turns the AA off, you can keep AA by using the ENB V0.119, colors will be a bit different though. For now, it\'s not compatible with any lighting mods such as Realistic Lighting, Climates of Tamriel...except[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/27043] Enhanced Lights and FX[/url].

[center][img]http://tof.canardpc.com/view/1e3a84e8-72ff-4fa1-b3de-68716bd07496.jpg[/img][/center]

[img]http://tof.canardpc.com/view/e9322c93-2cff-41bf-afdf-1893dbdfdde5.jpg[/img]

[youtube]g_tB81yyNkg[/youtube]

[img]http://tof.canardpc.com/view/2a9b7df1-8287-4f89-9174-71fa8a491189.jpg[/img]

V 1.00
Initial Release

[center][img]http://tof.canardpc.com/view/2c8a9c35-4ef7-41b7-8cf3-f741425f1eed.jpg[/img][/center]

[img]http://tof.canardpc.com/view/cffa5211-f692-4109-acd4-8c141124f284.jpg[/img]
Sorry, there will be no Climates of Tamriel version of this ENB, I have tried but it\'s too much a hassle. Some other ENBs were designed to work with COT and they do it wonderfully...this one wasn\'t.

[center][img]http://tof.canardpc.com/view/f4cd65f8-d065-49d0-bb09-c4d42a6da6ac.jpg[/img][/center]

[img]http://tof.canardpc.com/view/f9050d66-321d-4938-9d0b-610bb5d280c2.jpg[/img]

- Download, extract and copy the ENB v0.123 files in your Skyrim folder, use wrapper version.
- Do not forget to change bFloatPointRenderTarget=1, bTreesReceiveShadows=1, bdrawlandshadows=1 and bShadowsOnGrass=1 in your Skyrimprefs.ini
- Download, extract and copy this ENB files in your Skyrim folder. Overwrite when asked.

[center][img]http://tof.canardpc.com/view/868e61e0-5ebe-4094-a42f-f78de73a43d0.jpg[/img][/url][/center]

[img]http://tof.canardpc.com/view/2cb6402c-f77c-4c48-945a-96f8bc5712fa.jpg[/img]

[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/27043]- Enhanced Lights and FX by anamorfus [/url]

[center][img]http://tof.canardpc.com/view/d62e486d-5fc1-4178-ac82-2153256a1f66.jpg[/img][/center]

[img]http://tof.canardpc.com/view/1f3972c4-2799-4ce8-8fe3-af23e96e246b.jpg[/img]

Boris Vorontsov - for his ENB v0.123.
Midhras - author of Midhrastic ENB for Fallout 3, who inspired the most this ENB. 
LSiwora - author of the Wilds, some ENBseries.ini values.
Plutoman101 - realistic lighting esps.
HeliosDoubleSix - postprocessing assets in enbeffect.fx
Matso - DOF, Immersive Bloom, Anamorphic Flare.
Dirty Peasant - additions to enbeffect/enbbloom code.
Sharpshooter8 - For the enbpalette (I couldn\'t contact him via message, his mailbox must be full, to ask his permission, if this is a problem for him, I will take it off)
author: Windofthenords
